overview: Asael Dror has over 20 years experience in conceiving, architecting, developing, and evaluating cutting-edge system software and hardware. At Calista Technologies, he is responsible for the overall system architecture and key algorithms. His graphics experience began at Chips and Technologies, where he invented and implemented the first 32-bit, flat-memory display architecture for Windows. He has also consulted to industry leaders, including: ATI, Microsoft, MGI Software, Oak Technology, S3, Sigma Designs, Standard Microsystems, Western Digital, and Zoran. Asael was the founder and Editor-in-Chief of the Windows Developer Letter, as well as the author of three computer programming books. Prior to joining Calista, Asael was the Director of Platform Technologies at Teneros.
